title: How to copy a Vector3d in Python?
question:
Hello!

Is there a simpler way to copy a Vector3D than like so?

Thereâ€™s no Copy() or Set() method in Vector3D.




import Rhino.Geometry as rg


va = rg.Vector3d(1,2,3)

vb = rg.Vector3d(0,0,0)


vb.X = va.X

vb.Y = va.Y

vb.Z = va.Z

vb *= 10


print va

print vb




Thanks!

Best regards

Eugen

code_blocks.code:
import Rhino.Geometry as rg

va = rg.Vector3d(1,2,3)
vb = rg.Vector3d(va)
vc = vb

vb.X = 10

print "va =", va 
print "vb =", vb 
print "vc =", vc

vb *= 10 

print "va =", va 
print "vb =", vb 
print "vc =", vc
code_blocks.author: Jess
